summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is identified as an authorizing official on several payroll authorization forms for employees of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature appears on documents related to staff payroll, indicating his role in approving employment, salary adjustments, and other personnel actions within the committee. The documents span from 1976 to 1979, reflecting his involvement during the HSCA's active investigation period. The consistent pattern across the documents is his authorization of payroll-related actions for HSCA staff, suggesting an administrative or oversight role within the committee's operations.
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature on payroll documents indicates his involvement in the administrative and operational aspects of the committee's work, though the documents do not reveal the extent of his influence on the investigation itself. His authorization of payroll actions suggests he held a position of authority within the HSCA.
